c-0: ^Did I do something wrong? I just wanted to say hi to you, but now I'm worried.
c-1: ^Yes I do thank you very much. I was hoping that you could not look like you want to attack the audience?

C1: ^Sorry, force of habit. Usually when you come to me you need help with something mundane because you're too lazy to do it yourself.

c-0: ^Dang. So no confidence in me then? I'll just have to prove you wrong then, won't I?
^You can try, but good luck with it. You're gonna have to do a lot better than just cleaning up trash and adjusting the volumes of our intruments.
c-1: ^Okay, I get it. You don't have any confidence in me and my ability to help. But I'm trying to change that by helping you guys here.

^It's just that you've tried to change in the past and wound back up at the start. I just don't want that to happen here because it'll screw us up as well. You seem to be doing fine right now, but try and keep it that way.

C2: ^One of them was looking at me funny and I didn't appreciate it.

c-0: ^Was one of them actually looking at you weird? What if you just ignore them then?

c-1: ^What if you made a funny face back to them? It shows that they aren't getting a rise out of you, unlike the "I will fight you" face you were doing.
